name: Forward validations Feature
description:
As a user
  I want to perform Trade Validations
  So that I acheive a business goal

children.name: Verify the Validate endpoint for Valid Data
Given User has valid data to post for 'Forward'
When User posts the json request
Then Verify the response is valid
Verify error message when value date is before trade date
Given User has Value Date older than Trade Date for product type 'Forward'
When User posts the json request
Then Verify the response contains the 'cannot be null and it has to be after trade date' error message
Verify error message when when value date is on weekend
Given User has the Value Date on weekend for product type 'Forward'
When User posts the json request
Then Verify the response contains the 'cannot fall on Saturday/Sunday' error message
Verify error message when Invalid Customer is provided
Given User has Invalid counterparty for product type 'Forward'
When User posts the json request
Then Verify the response contains the 'is not supported. Supported counterparties: [[PLUTO2, PLUTO1]]' error message
Verify error message when Invalid Legal Entity is provided. Requirement: It should accept only CS Zurich as LE. Defect: It is accepting any string as Legal Entity
Given User has Invalid Legal entity for product type 'Forward'
When User posts the json request
Then Verify the response contains the 'is not supported. Supported Legal entity: [CS Zurich]' error message

stackTrace.methodName: Verify the response contains the 'is not supported. Supported Legal entity: [CS Zurich]' error message

exception.stackTrace:
org.junit.ComparisonFailure: expected:<[ERROR]> but was:<[SUCCESS]>
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:115)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:144)
	at com.qe.vt.steps.ValidationsSteps.responseContainsTheRequiredErrorMessage(ValidationsSteps.java:63)
	at ✽.Verify the response contains the 'is not supported. Supported Legal entity: [CS Zurich]' error message(classpath:features/ForwardValidations.feature:29)
exception.name: org.junit.ComparisonFailure

stackTrace.methodName: Verify the response contains the 'is not supported. Supported Legal entity: [CS Zurich]' error message

exceptions.stackTrace:
org.junit.ComparisonFailure: expected:<[ERROR]> but was:<[SUCCESS]>
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:115)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:144)
	at com.qe.vt.steps.ValidationsSteps.responseContainsTheRequiredErrorMessage(ValidationsSteps.java:63)
	at ✽.Verify the response contains the 'is not supported. Supported Legal entity: [CS Zurich]' error message(classpath:features/ForwardValidations.feature:29)

children.name: Verify error message when Invalid ISO Currency is provided in ccy pair
Given User has Invalid ISO Currency for product type 'Forward'
When User posts the json request
Then Verify the response contains the 'Invalid currency pair' error message

name: Invalid Product Type validations Feature
description:
As a user
  I want to perform Trade Validations
  So that I acheive a business goal

children.name: Verify error message when Invalid Product Type is provided.
Given User has Invalid Product Type in input
When User posts the json request
Then Verify the response contains the 'Could not resolve type id' error message

name: Options validations Feature
description:
As a user
  I want to perform Trade Validations
  So that I acheive a business goal

children.name: Verify the Validate endpoint for Valid Data with EUROPEAN Style
Given User has valid data to post for Options with European Style
When User posts the json request
Then Verify the response is valid
Verify the Validate endpoint for Valid Data with AMERICAN Style
Given User has valid data to post for Options with American Style
When User posts the json request
Then Verify the response is valid
Verify error message for Invalid Style
Given User has Invalid Style in input
When User posts the json request
Then Verify the response contains the 'Invalid option style | Valid option styles are: [AMERICAN, EUROPEAN]' error message
Verify error message when Exercise Start Date is before Trade Date
Given User has data having Exercise Start Date before Trade Date
When User posts the json request
Then Verify the response contains the 'Trade date | has to be before exercise start date' error message
